body: Did you miss my mail on the dev list?  I tested hive with this change -- it still fails.  I backed up to the previous VM image, and it passes.

This change needs to go in anyway. This change was done based on the hprof I obtained from jenkins output a couple of days ago. See  http://traf-testlogs.esgyn.com/Daily-master/216/regress-hive-cdh/traf_run/logs/
Previous Test Aborted. New Check Test Started: https://jenkins.esgyn.com/job/Check-PR-master/751/

Thanks Kevin. Looks ok to me. Don't exactly understand all the intricacies of xml but guess we are explicitly excluding the dependencies. Following commit removed the corresponding dependencies (tomcat) earlier:
https://github.com/apache/incubator-trafodion/commit/7fe6dd13600a931986769fb30c886ca6efb7c7ee
Thanks Anu - looks ok to me. Thanks for taking care of the jps issue.
Thanks @DaveBirdsall  Changes look good to me. Note for committers: Use --squash option to squash all the rework into one commit

Syntax and details have been added to the attached spec.
[Trafodion LOB interface.docx](https://github.com/apache/incubator-trafodion/files/287193/Trafodion.LOB.interface.docx)
Looks good to me. The only potentially serious concern is the upward/backward compatibility concern but maybe that's not a real concern.
Investigating one regression test failure. Please hold merge.
Previous Test Aborted. New Check Test Started: https://jenkins.esgyn.com/job/Check-PR-master/759/
Do not merge this fix just yet. It appears the assert is actually hitting in a few of the regression tests (unexpectedly!).
Thanks, this plugs a big hole in our design! I didn't look at every nook and cranny, but what I saw looks good to me.
Code looks good to me so far, hope you won't have too much trouble getting the regressions to work (will we need a third level??).
Yeah, @zellerh, the assert is firing under some DDL operations. So I know I need a three-deep stack at least. Or perhaps we are simply too promiscuous with our HOLDs and RESTOREs. Debugging it now.

Hi Kevin, Do please provide context for this change. 

Currently we handle the  catalog API queries in mxosrvr and T2 driver. Are you planning to shift that logic to all the drivers ? Is it possible to encapsulate the logic only in T2 and not make all the other drivers aware of the metadata layout? This should also address the configuration when we move away from mxosrvrs. 

Again just guessing why this change may be needed, but please do provide the reasoning.

Hi Arvind, Different driver has different definition of metadata(especially, what kinds of columns they want). And yes, I'll move all of them into driver-side exception ODBC. As you see, these two APIs were not supported and somebody required them recently, so started from there.
By the way, procedure list can't be shown on DBVisualizer before. Now it's works with this fixes.
This is a neat way of setting the parserflags - much clearer and easier to use. Looks good !

It's not a fully support for SQLStatistics. I think we can merge it to make the ODBC preliminary support for SQLStatistics. 
I will continue investigating metadata table and make it support more result in the furture.
I've pushed a rework that makes it a stack of depth 3. Executor regressions now pass. Will run the other regressions as well while this PR is under review.
Thanks, looks good, and sorry for being the troublemaker that caused you extra work fixing old bugs.
No problem. The code is better off for it.

the new external table support @anoopsharma00  changed is another good way to support similar issue, this PR still has its own value to support direct Hive access. So let me fix Hans and Dave's comments and commit again.

The metadata queries shouldn't be influenced by the settings in the user context. The user application could have used CQDs, Control query shape and other settings to influence the behavior of the user query, It can make the catalog APIs to behave differently. Also, in the past we have used control query shape to influence and produce optimal  query plan for the metadata queries. In the days before Trafodion, we had used module file concept to isolate the metadata queries from being influenced by the user settings. In Trafodion, we need to have such isolation, otherwise we can get non-deterministic results/errors from these queries. The best place to do this isolation is the server side. 

It is good that DBVisualizer works with this change. But, we need to look at the change in a holistic way to make Trafodion robust.
Looks good to me. Good rework.
Looks good to me also. Thank you for this clean-up.
Closing this pull request, as it has been replaced by https://github.com/apache/incubator-trafodion/pull/519.
Looks good to me. The added comments are a BIG help to following the code. I don't know the answer to your one comment, "is this OK?" though.

+1

Good thing to try. Probably somebody pointed it out already, in a secure environment where regular HBase and Trafodion are mixed, the system administrators may not want to give Trafodion this blanket permission. But, it will be good to figure out a solution first and then improve it.

Yes, sorry for just putting that question there. I saw this behavior while debugging, but am not sure whether that's an observable bug (or a bug at all), since I'm not that familiar with the binder design.
The failures in the extra tests were to executor/TEST015 and hive/TEST003 and hive/TEST018 but only on the Cloudera side. On the Hortonworks side they pass. I will merge the change.

+1 Thanks for doing this @amandamoran If Trafodion needs to use snapshot, it might need to have this kind of blanket permission. If this is the solution, Trafodion needs to suppress the snapshot usage if this permission is not set.
